description: Average monthly income depends a lot on the main source of income and those relying mainly on aid are among those who have the highest monthly income.
title: Repartition of average monthly income per source of income

description: People who have been displaced for conflict reasons have mainly been displaced for over 2 years while displacements due to flood, or lack of food are more recent.
title: Duration of displacement per reason of displacement

description: Not knowing the geogaphical repartitions of the CBPN it is difficult to say but there seems to be some area of the camps where they seem to work better

All impressions related to CBPN are related (works, security, understand rôle).
That being said, we can see that when people trust the CBPN they are more likely to get information through community and DRC staff while when they do not, they get mostly the information through friends, family and outreach activities.
xtitle: How did you find out about DRC’s and CBPNs activities
title: Impression that CBPN works according to  how people found out about CBPN activities.

description: Source of information is quite different from one main source of income to another. For example small scale traders get their information mostly diretly from DRC staffs while landcultivators (among the most vulnerable according to the income) get their information mainly through community.
title: How people found out about CBPN/DRC activities according to main source of income.

description:
In Jamjang people seems to be much poorer and in Malakal people are wealthier.
However, given that in Malakal all people interviewed are in the camp and given that we saw that people relying on aid have higher average income, this could explain this.
title: Repartition of average monthly income per region

description: If we look at the monthly income per household member, the difference between Jamjang and Bentiu becomes thinner.
title: Repartition of average monthly  income (per family member) per region

description: In Malakal almost everyone got displaced due to conflict.
title: Reason for displacement per region

description: In Malakal most people rely on aid which explain the difference of income between regions
title: Primary source of income per region

description: Divorced or single families live with significantly less income than widow or married families
title: Repartition of average monthly  income (per family member) per marital status

description: While most of the interviewed families have female head, this is even more important among single, divorced and widowed families.
title: Gender of the head of the household per marital status

description: Host are more likely to be employed or self employed than IDPs or returnees.
title: Employment status per displacement status

description: IDPs have often higher income than hosts.
title: Repartition of average monthly income per displacement status

description: People who received training on CCCM are more likely to think that CBPN understand their rôle
xtitle: Did the CBPNs fully understand their roles?
title: How people think CBPN understand their according to whether they received CCCM training or not

description: The satisfaction with CBPN tends to decrease with the time people spent in the camp
xtitle: How would you rate your satisfaction level with the work of the CBPN in your community?
legendtitle: Satisfaction with CBPN according to time spent in the camp

People who have been trained on CCCM or protection are more likely to believe that their community leadership advocate their interests.
xtitle: Have you received training from DRC on CCCM and Protection?
title: How people think their community leadership advocate their interests according to whether they received CCCM training or not

description: The better the relationship with your community leadership is the more likely people will think the complaint mechanisms are effective.
xtitle:
Do you think the complaint and feedback mechanism
used so far is effective and sufficient?
title: Effectiveness of complaint feedback mechanism according to relationship with community leaders

description: Likewise, when people believe their leaders advocate their interestsare more likely to believe the complaint feedback mechanism is effective and sufficient.
xtitle:
Do you think the complaint and feedback mechanism
used so far is effective and sufficient?
title: Effectiveness of complaint feedback mechanism according to the feeling that the community leaders advocate their interests.

title: How people think the project targeted the right beneficiaries according to relationship with community leadership
